title: A Brief Summary of the Group-Variation Equations
abstract: A brief summary is given of the Group-Variation Equations and the island diagram confinement mechanism, with an explanation of the prediction that the cylinder-topology minimal-area spanning surface term in the correlation function of two Wilson loops at large $N_c$, when it exists, must have a pre-exponential factor, which for large area $A$ of the minimal-area cylinder-topology spanning surface, decreases with increasing $A$ at least as fast as $1/\ln(\sigma A)$, where $\sigma$ is the area law parameter. This prediction is expected to be testable in lattice calculations.
